nodes.text: Nebulae were clouds of swirling dust and interstellar gas in space, identifiable by its amorphous color pattern. Notable examples included the Monsua, Kaliida, Metharian, Typhonic, Vulpinus, Queluhan and Ghost nebulae. Some, like the Archeon Nebula, were stellar nurseries, in which new stars were formed. Nebulae could hide many mysteries, and the world of Lira San was hidden behind a treacherous nebula formed from a collapsing star.
